The Senate is awaiting was also the FBI investigation into Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh NPR's Windsor Johnston reports the agency is looking into allegations of sexual misconduct stem from Kavanaugh's high school and college days
She FBI is in the process that interviewing witnesses and an attempt to corroborate the stories that cat and all and his initial accuser Christine Blasey Ford Senator Jeff flake the Republican who played a key role in securing a delight to allow time for the ... says the FBI needs to be thorough

What else economic adviser Larry Kudlow is defend the administration's new trade agreement with Mexico and Canada as NPR's Scott Horsley explains the agreement drew criticism from the conservative editorial page of the wall Street Journal
Kudlow there was a former CNBC commentator calls the Journal's editorial writers dear friends but he takes issue with their criticism of the trade deal nothing is perfect Kudlow says the deal provides an update the NAFTA which took effect a quarter century ago
We've improved the supply chains of tariffs would we notice a tear free zone in ... in effect supply chains of the their business will not be disrupted all those threats have not come to pass so I think it's good to presidents or some credit
Never mind that it was the president himself who threaten cross border supply chains with promises to tear up NAFTA if he didn't get his way Kudlow stumbled over the name of the new NAFTA which Trump insisted on rebranding as the U.S and CIA Scott Horsley NPR News the White House
Reserve board chairman Jerome Powell seems to be taking a steady as she goes approach in terms of the bodies current interest rate policy

I mean his near fifth year lows inflation is roughly at our two percent objective and that the baseline outlook of many forecasters inside and outside the fast the fed this for more of the same house as the

Online retail giant Amazon is taking a major step today I think it's minimum wage for all us workers to Fifteen dollars an hour the company says the move will benefit more than three hundred and fifty thousand employees that that was up a hundred and twenty two points this is NPR
Secretary of state Mike Pompeo is getting off for a third time to North Korea for another round of talks ultimately aimed at convincing North Korean leader Kim Jong loon to give up his country's nuclear weapons
Bomb pale reportedly will travel to pain young Saturday to meet with a North Korean president State Department spokeswoman Heather Nauert told reporters palm pay will be pushing for progress achieving the goal of denuclearization agreed upon by President Trump and Kim during the summit in Singapore
New study is finding a simple rules change in college football could dramatically cut the risk of concussions NPR's Jon Hamilton reports on research in the journal of the American Medical Association
More than twenty percent of concussions in college football occurred during kickoffs when players often collided full speed
So in two thousand Fifteen Ivy League schools moved to kick off line five yards up the field the idea was to make it less likely to double would be returned and an analysis by three Ivy League scientists found that the change reduce the chance of a concussion during kickoffs by more than ... eighty percent
The NFL also saw a decrease in brain injuries after changing its kickoff rules in two thousand eleven and the new studies author said that if schools beyond the ivy league made similar rule changes it might reduce concussions were all college football players
